intro: Pimpinella parishii, commonly known as the New Zealand cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and along stream banks. It has a slender, branched stem and produces small, spherical fruits called schizocarps. Pimpinella parishii is an important component of New Zealand's native flora and is often found in conservation areas.
